intro: Gillbeea whypallana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gillbeea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Gillbeea whypallana is often found in open woodlands and is known for its resilience to drought conditions.
